text:
It is with an immeasurable amount of sorrow that we must inform supporters that Peter Whittingham has passed away at the age of 35.
We are heartbroken.
The news of Peter’s sudden and untimely passing has shaken us to our very foundation. Our love goes out to his wife Amanda, their young son and family. They are at the forefront of our thoughts and, on their behalf, we ask for their privacy to be respected at this unfathomably cruel and difficult time.
First and foremost, Peter was a family man - and somebody who could light up a room with his sense of humour, warmth and personality. Then, as a professional footballer - as a Bluebird - he excelled with talent, ease, grace and humility. Nobody did it better.
The loss of Peter will be painfully felt by our city, supporters and indeed all who ever had the pleasure of knowing him. We love you Pete and your memory will eternally stay with us.
CARDIFFCITYFC.CO.UK
Club Statement | Peter Whittingham | Cardiff
shared_text:
CARDIFFCITYFC.CO.UK
Club Statement | Peter Whittingham | Cardiff

Cardiff City Football Club has been deeply shocked and saddened at the passing of our former defender, Chris Barker.
We offer our deepest condolences to Chris’ family, friends, former team-mates and colleagues. He will be greatly missed by us all.
Details of a Club tribute to Chris will follow in the coming days. On behalf of Chris’ family, we’d ask for them to be afforded privacy at this very difficult time.

Cardiff City Football Club are saddened to hear of the passing of Matthew Brazier.
Much loved by supporters in the Welsh capital, Matthew played for City between 1998 and 2002.
Our thoughts are with his family and all who knew him.
Forever a Bluebird.

HALF-TIME: Tavistock AFC 0-5 Cardiff City Football Club
Junior Hoilett, Joe Ralls, Gary Madine (2) and Bobby Reid are on the score-sheet as the #Bluebirds start their tour of Devon and Cornwall in style.
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

Neil Warnock's men kick off their tour of Devon & Cornwall against Tavistock AFC at 7pm!
Cardiff City Football Club: Etheridge, Peltier, Morrison (C), Ecuele Manga, Cunningham, Hoilett, Paterson, Ralls, J. Murphy, Reid, Madine.
Subs: Smithies, B. Murphy, Richards, Connolly, Bennett, K. Harris, Mendez-Laing, Ward.
Follow all the action live via our Twitter account - https://twitter.com/CardiffCityFC
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

The First Team are here at Taff's Well this evening to meet with our supporters - while the playing squad is made up of mostly U23 players and trialists.
Can't be here? Follow all the action live via our Twitter account - https://twitter.com/CardiffCityFC
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

Extended highlights from today's 'Kevin McNaughton Benefit Match' to follow later this week!
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

FULL TIME: McNaughton XI 5-5 Bellamy XI (McNaughton's men win with a Super Kev pen)
A wonderful match, and all round day as we show our appreciation for a Cardiff City Football Club legend!
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

87 & 90 - GOALS!!! Archie and Finlay McNaughton score for Super Kev!
McNaughton XI 5-5 Bellamy XI

82 - GOAL!!! Tom Jenkins restores Bellamy's two goal lead!
McNaughton XI 3-5 Bellamy XI
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

79 - GOAL!!! "What's that coming over the hill...' Michael Chopra! 👏
McNaughton XI 3-4 Bellamy XI
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

62 - GOAL!!! Damon Searle curls in a superb left footed effort. Big task now for McNaughton's men!
McNaughton XI 2-4 Bellamy XI

53 - GOAL!!! Whittingham and Bellamy stand aside as Jason Mohammad fires in a free kick from 20-yards! Brilliant set piece from the BBC Sport presenter! Bellamy's men lead for the first time.
McNaughton XI 2-3 Bellamy XI

51 - GOAL!!! Craig Bellamy nets for his own side from 25-yards!
McNaughton XI 2-2 Bellamy XI

HALF-TIME: Kevin McNaughton XI 2-1 Craig Bellamy XI
Enjoyable match, and great fun so far!
#CityAsOne 🔵⚽️🔵⚽️

36 - GOAL!!! Aberdeen Football Club veteran Darren Mackie pops up with a goal just moments after coming on to give Kevin McNaughton's team the lead again.
McNaughton XI 2-1 Bellamy XI

26 - GOAL!!! Craig Noone levels it up - his shot going in off the post after a lovely pass from Trevor Sinclair!
McNaughton XI 1-1 Bellamy XI

15 - GOAL!!! Kevin McNaughton with a composed finish following Steve Thompson's cut back! His first goal at Cardiff City Stadium!
McNaughton XI 1-0 Bellamy XI

Kevin McNaughton Starting XI: Peat, K. McNaughton, Hudson, Turner, Naylor, McPhail, B. McNaughton, O'Donoghue, Cowie, Chopra, Thompson.
Craig Bellamy Starting XI: Alexander, Searle, Scimeca, Purse, Legg, Whittingham, Parry, Noone, Sinclair, Earnshaw, Campbell.
Kick-off in just over 20 mins!
#CityAsOne

text:
AWAY TRAVEL INFO: Cardiff City Football Club supporters travelling to Birmingham City FC, please note there is a full road closure of the Aston Expressway from Friday evening, lasting all weekend. This includes junction 6 of the M6.
Due to this, fans are being asked to use the M42, exit at Junction 6 and then use the A45 into St Andrew's.
